Posts.Content: ejnova wrote: i'm usually a calm, tolerant person. yesterday i went to work at an apple retail store and the mall blocked off the closest parking spots because customers were complaining that employees were taking all the closest parking spots. so . . . i parked outside the "forbidden" area but still close. a guy sitting outside starbucks drinking his coffee said loud enough for me to hear "see it doesn't make any difference, they'll still take OUR parking spots.", i walked right over to him and said sir "i probably could get a handicap parking permit, but i'm fighting it. i have stage IV cancer, one lung and a tumor in the other lung. perhaps you ought to think before opening your mouth" and then i just walked away leaving him a bit stunned. thanks for letting me bitch, ladies. Posts.Content: ejnova wrote: just diagnosed with breast to bone mets (i had two primary cancers nine years ago). breast for which i had mastectomy and chemo and radiation - was told 90% cure and also had second primary of lung cancer and had upper and mid lobe of lung removed - 50% cure). and guess which came back - the breast cancer. just looking to talk with someone who also had bone mets. i'm currently on arimidex. i'm to try this for three months and then be retested and go from there. any insight from anyone who's fighting this same situation?
